channel.title: business on Newsround
channel.description: Recent content in business on Newsround

item.title: Homeowners don’t want to move. It’s a big deal for their shrinking backyards. - The Washington Post
item.description: Americans have more and more reasons to have smaller outdoor spaces.

item.title: The best Amazon deals and rare sales this weekend from Apple, Ugg, Shark and more are up to 70% off - Yahoo
item.description: Also on our savings radar? Mega markdowns on Apple, NutriBullet, Michael Kors, Ugg and more.

item.title: Popular pet retailer files Chapter 11 bankruptcy - thestreet.com
item.description: The company faces major legal hurdles and mounting debts.

item.title: ‘No Reasons to Own’: Software Stocks Sink on Fear of New AI Tool - Bloomberg.com
item.description: The new year was supposed to bring opportunities for beaten-down software stocks. Instead, the group is off to its worst start in years.

item.title: Trump suffers major losses in his war on offshore wind - Politico
item.description: The administration’s arguments that offshore wind farms present a national security risk failed to convince judges in three separate courts.

item.title: Why Coinbase derailed the crypto industry’s political future - The Verge
item.description: The powerful crypto exchange objected to a draft of the market structure bill at the last minute, infuriating the rest of the industry.

item.description: New batteries in electric vehicles could store more energy, charge faster and last longer, while lowering fire risk

item.description: I have to find a way to do this.

item.title: 3 Tesla Owners React to Elon Musk's FSD Change - Business Insider
item.description: Tesla owners' reactions to Elon Musk’s announcement that FSD would only be available for $99 a month ranged from frustration to enthusiasm.

item.title: What to Expect in Markets This Week: Trump Davos Speech, MLK Holiday, PCE Inflation, Netflix, Intel Earnings - Investopedia
item.description: Coming up: Trump speech at Davos, Martin Luther King Jr. holiday, PCE inflation report, GDP update, and earnings from Netflix, Intel, and more.

item.description: “I don’t have a specific consequence to outline for you but certainly this is an expectation and frankly a demand that the president has made.”

item.title: China’s New Tech Stock Boom Leaves Its Economic Malaise Behind - Bloomberg.com
item.description: Nearly a year after DeepSeek’s AI breakthrough rattled global markets, China is entering 2026 with a fresh wave of technological advances that are powering a stock rally, even as its economy remains fragile.

item.title: Recent Trump investments reignite concerns around potential conflicts of interest - CNN
item.description: President Donald Trump purchased up to $2 million in Netflix and Warner Bros. Discovery investments days after the announcement of a megadeal between the two media giants, among other purchases, according to a financial disclosure from the White House, renewi…

item.title: 'Young 40': The South Korean millennials mocked for 'trying too hard' - BBC
item.description: Even the iPhone, long considered the preserve of the youth, has been recast as a tacky trademark of Young 40s.

item.title: Behind the Curtain: The AI future has arrived - Axios
item.description: Claude shows in vivid and unforgettable ways how AI will forever change work.

item.description: AI-generated sexual imagery of children has raised alarms with regulators and lawmakers.

item.description: Depending where you are in the US, you’re bound to encounter a wide array of different French fries. Here are the absolute best, as styled by state.

item.title: Trump Blasts Dimon, Threatens to Sue JPMorgan Over Debanking - Bloomberg.com
item.description: President Donald Trump railed against JPMorgan Chase & Co. and its leader Jamie Dimon, threatening to sue the banking giant over his claim that he was debanked after the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol riot.

item.title: Trump threatens to sue JPMorgan Chase for 'debanking' him - CNBC
item.description: President Trump threatened to sue JPMorgan for allegedly “debanking” him following the Jan. 6 insurrection in 2021.

item.description: To speed the construction of new energy plants, the Trump administration called for an emergency power auction. They favor gas, coal and nuclear.

item.description: Prediction market apps are thriving in Trump’s second term, with traders betting on migrant deportations to election outcomes. A community of young, mostly male and very online traders are driving the industry’s bonanza.
